1.content:
Abominations, along with those who possess genetic memory, have access to vast knowledge. This, when combined with their psychological instability, those deemed Abomination are feared and considered very dangerous by the Sisterhood. Standing orders exist for Bene Gesserit that anyone believed to be Abomination are to be immediately killed.

Abomination and the Great Temptation:
While Abomination is primarily used to describe being overwhelmed by the ego-memory of an ancestor, Alia and Lady Jessica also use the term to describe those who have succumbed to the Great Temptation: altering their internal chemistry to arrest the aging process and live indefinitely. When she first sees the fact that Alia has not aged at all since she last saw her, she realizes that the apparent rumors amongst the Bene Gesserit that her daughter is engaged in these forbidden practices are true.

10.content:
The Battle of Corrin (88 BG) was the space battle from which the Imperial House Corrino took its name. It was fought on Corrin near Sigma Draconis and settled the ascendancy of the ruling House from Salusa Secundus.
After the Battle, Bashar Abulurd Harkonnen was accused of cowardice by an Atreides and exiled, this event started the feud between House Harkonnen and House Atreides which would last for almost 10,000 years.

100.content: Stilgar is a Fremen who is the Naib of Sietch Tabr and the Governor of Arrakis from 10196 AG onwards. He is a close friend and chief advisor to Emperor Paul-Muad'Dib Atreides.

101.content: A stillsuit is a full body suit worn in the open desert of the planet Arrakis that is designed to preserve the body's moisture. It consists of various layers that will absorb the body's moisture through sweating and urination, and then filter the impurities so that drinkable water will be circulated to catchpockets. The individual can then drink the reclaimed water from a tube attached to the neck. A stillsuit, kept in working order and maintained properly, permits the wearer to survive for weeks in the open desert.

102.content:
A stunner (sometimes named a slammer, in order to avoid confusion with sonic firearms) is a refined version of the Terran pneumatic speargun. This slow-pellet projectile weapon is widely favored for the fact that it can be used safely against shields.
The weapon throws a poison-tipped or drug-tipped dart. A stunner's effectiveness is limited by variations in shield settings, and by relative motion between the projectile and its target.

Stats

Range: 1 - 120 meters (will penetrate an active shield only at 80 meters and closer)
Settings: 1 - 6 (will penetrate an active shield only at settings 1 - 5)
Size: 15 - 20 centimeters (barrel)
Mass: 1 - 2 kilograms
Ammunition: 15 rounds per clip

103.content:
Suspensors: The Holtzmann Effect's repellent effect allows physical objects equipped with a Holtzman field generator to defy gravity.
The Holtzman Suspensors are hovering devices which utilize the secondary (low-drain) phase of a Holtzman field generator to nullify gravity within certain limits prescribed by relative mass and energy consumption.
The original conceptor of the suspensors was Norma Cenva, while working for Tio Holtzman on Poritrin. It was based on Holtzman's original shield design, but was then heavily modified by herself. The first invention which employed this principle are the glowglobes.
Suspensors are used in chairs, tables, and structures that are too massive to be physically sound, among many other obvious uses.
The grotesquely obese Baron Vladimir Harkonnen utilised suspensor belts and harnesses to buoy his flesh and allow him to walk. Suspensors are also used to generate artificial gravity aboard spaceships.

104.content:
A Tahaddi Challenge is a Fremen challenge to mortal combat, usually to test some primal issue, such as if leadership is challenged or to test a prophecy.
Paul Atreides killed Jamis in mortal combat after Jamis invoked the Amtal Rule, and issued the Tahaddi Challenge to him.

Succession: In Fremen society, someone wishing to become the Naib of the tribe must "call out" the current Naib; issue the Tahaddi Challenge and fight to the death.
When Paul Atreides took the mantle of Mahdi, he changed this custom, refusing to call Stilgar out, as he did not want to weaken the Fremen before their battle against the Harkonnen. He also did not want to kill his friend. He made it extremely clear to the Fremen that no one man could stand against him in single combat, and that it was foolish for the Fremen to kill their best and wisest leaders for the sake of ritual.

105.content:
The majority of people do not realize that to know the future is to be trapped by it. Paul can see that he will have to lead humanity onto a drastic course in order for it to escape its own annihilation. And thus, as Paul walks along the Golden Path, Muad'Dib's Jihad rages across the entire known universe of the Imperium as a new order is established.

The Golden Path ("Secher Nbiw" in an ancient language) is an expansive prescient interpretation that is only visible to the Kwisatz Haderach and the Bene Gesserit. It foretells the fluid events of the future, both great and small. More profoundly, however, it reveals an optimum path through the countless threads of cause and effect that are encountered by the human race.

106.content: The Imperium is the totality of known space ruled by the emperor and the inhabited planets within.

107.content:
The Voice is the ability to influence people directly by giving them orders with a certain sound frequency. When a person is ordered to do something by the use of Voice it is almost impossible not to comply. A Bene Gesserit is trained to resist the Voice. The downside of it is the phenomenon of the entire population becoming immune to it if The Voice is being overly used upon a population. Mentats can especially become immune to the Voice if he understands how it works.
The Voice is an audio-neuro control mechanism that enables the manipulation of speech to achieve complete control over a receiver. It was perfected by the Bene Gesserit Sisterhood through the combined training of several advanced techniques.

108.content:
Tleilaxu Master is a rank in the social system of the Bene Tleilax rated above Face Dancer, with Face Dancers often used as mules to do their bidding. They are known to use a specialized humming or whistling language to control Face Dancers and gholas.
The nine Masheikhs who govern Bene Tleilax through the Ruling Council are chosen from the Master ranks.
At times, if Face Dancers live enough serial lives as gholas, they are elevated to Master status. Scytale is one example of this. 
Description: They look physically similar to small humans, most often with small close-set eyes and a set of small pointed teeth.

109.content:
A Truthsayer is anyone trained to detect truth when it is being told, with the ability itself being referred to as truthsense. Truthsayers are often employed by the Imperium on behalf of the Padishah Emperor.
Truthsayers are capable of invoking a truth trance, enabling them to detect the falseness or truth of spoken sentences.

11.content:
"BENE GESSERIT: the ancient school of mental and physical training established primarily for female students after the Butlerian Jihad destroyed the so-called "thinking machines" and robots."
    ―Terminology of the Imperium
The Bene Gesserit Order are an ancient organization who operate behind an impenetrable screen of ritual mysticism, and whose training, symbolism, organization, and internal teaching methods are almost wholly religious. The Sisterhood consists of all-women spies, nuns, scientists, and theologians who use genetic experimentation, galactic political interference, and religious engineering to further their own agenda of ascending the human race with the advent of their chosen one, the Kwisatz Haderach.
Roles in order of importance - 
    The Reverend Mother Superior
    Kwisatz Mother
    Proctor Superior
    Truthsayer
    Reverend Mothers
    Sister
    Initiate
Powers and abilities:     
    Oral Analysis
    Internal Organic-Chemical Control
    Prana-Bindu
    Weirding Way
    The Voice
    Sensing the Truth
    Fertility Control

110.content: Mentats are required to operate within an ethical framework, which for some purposes may not be desired. Thus, the Bene Tleilax are known to condition some Mentats to be 'twisted'. These Twisted Mentat individuals are able to supralogically hypothesize, strategize and tacticize trends free of any ethical restraints or limitations.

111.content:
War of Assassins is a limited form of warfare that is permitted under the Great Convention and the Guild Peace during the time of the Corrinos.
It stipulates that formal declarations of intent are required, and it only permits certain kinds of weapons and practices, as outlined in the Assassins' Handbook. These rules are put in place to protect innocent bystanders.

112.content:
The Water of Life is a poisonous blue liquid used by the Bene Gesserit to turn their Sisters into Reverend Mothers and by the Fremen to turn Sayyadinas into Reverend Mothers. To the untrained in prana-bindu body control, the substance is lethal and even the smallest amount will kill someone in incredible agony. 

Sources: The Water of Life originates on the planet Dune. It begins its life as the bile of a young sandworm, and, if it does not kill the Bene Gesserit or Sayyadina who ingests it, is converted into an awareness spectrum narcotic that is used in spice orgies.

113.content:
The Weirding Way is a Superior hand-to-hand combat martial art style all Bene Gesserit are trained in. Bene Gesserit trained men and women are unrivaled in their fighting abilities. Only Imperial Sardaukar and the Fremen of Arrakis can approach the abilities of a Bene Gesserit in regard to combat techniques, attack speed, and resourcefulness.
    Example: Paul was trained by his mother in the Weirding Way of the Bene Gesserit, allowing him to maneuver around and strike an opponent at unimaginable speeds. When first encountering Sietch Tabr this saved his life, as he was able to overcome the Fremen who saught to kill him and Jessica for their water by means of the Weirding Way. He later taught the Way to many of the Fremen across Arrakis, making them into skilled and deadly Fedaykin by these means, and this was a key factor in his victory in the Battle of Arrakeen.

114.content:
Wensicia Corrino is the third daughter of Padishah Emperor Shaddam Corrino IV and Lady Anirul. She marries Dalak Fenring and gives birth to Farad'n Corrino. After Shaddam's defeat by Muad'Dib and the Fremen, she follows her family into exile on Salusa Secundus.

Exile: Attempting to prepare her son for rule she orders Sardaukar bashar Tyekanik as his principal instructor. She even orders him to follow the religion of Muad'Dib, hoping that Farad'n will see the benefit of controlling his new Imperium by manipulating religious belief.

115.content:
On the planet Arrakis, a windtrap is a facility designed to reclaim the moisture in the air and funnel it to large catchbasins for later use by the Fremen.
The air of Arrakis is usually hot and dry. However, at night, when the air cools, some moisture will develop. This moisture will then be carried by winds across the surface of the planet. Essentially a large air intake, the windtraps capture this air so that the moisture can be extracted from it by the Fremen, after it condenses.
Imperial Planetologist Pardot Kynes incorporated the windtraps into his terraforming program. However, he had surmised that the water reclaimed from this system would not be enough, and that a self-sustaining precipitation system would need to exist. As a result, he began a plantation drive across the planet.

116.content: The yali is a Fremen term that refers to someone's personal quarters within a sietch. When someone dies in the Tahaddi Challenge, the victor claims the dead man's yali, his possessions (excluding those given away in the Fremen Funeral Rite), his coffee service (if he has one), even his wife and children.

117.content: Zensunni is a religious belief system, a denomination of Buddislam, prominent with many cultures spread across the Known Universe, especially those descended from disadvantaged and enslaved peoples.

12.content:
Bene Tleilax, or the Tleilaxu as they are more commonly called, are a group of secretive, genetically altered humans who inhabit Tleilax, the sole planet of the star Thalim. The customs and ethics of the Bene Tleilax led to widespread revulsion by the other cultures of the Known Universe, a reaction that does little to quench the Tleilaxu's hunger to subjugate their rivals. Their skills with genetic engineering, however, make them effectively a "necessary evil". 

Classes:
The Tleilaxu are separated into several different classes, each of which has a distinct physical appearance and role within their society. The primary groups are:
    Tleilaxu Masters
    Axlotl Tanks
    Face Dancers

13.content:
"I'm a person, you know. Persons come in many shapes and sizes. This is but one of them. I'm weak of muscle, but strong of mouth; cheap to feed, but costly to fill. Empty me as you will, there's still more in me than men put there."
    ―Bijaz cryptically telling Paul Atreides his nature

Master Bijaz is a Tleilaxu Master and a prescient dwarf, who is invisible to others' prescience. He speaks cryptically in riddles and rhymes. 

    "We are like brothers. We grew in the same tank: I first and then you."
    ―Bijaz describes his connection with Duncan while imprisoned in the keep in Arrakeen

    "You’ve sired, Sire. You are much more than the base Usul. You’re the Atreides Emperor, Paul Muad'Dib. And you are my finger."
    ―Bijaz to Paul Atreides

14.content:
"We must negate the machines-that-think. Humans must set their own guidelines. This is not something machines can do. Reasoning depends upon programming, not on hardware, and we are the ultimate program! Our Jihad is a "dump program." We dump the things which destroy us as humans!"
    ― Minister-companion of the Jihad

The Butlerian Jihad, also known as the Great Revolt as well as commonly shortened to the Jihad, was the crusade against computers, thinking machines, and conscious robots that began in 201 BG and concluded in 108 BG. The results of the Butlerian victory are:
1. All computers, thinking machines and conscious robots are destroyed
2. Machine-based technology is wiped out.
3. The majority of historical documents are destroyed, including the location of the Earth.

15.content:
"May you die on Caladan!"
    ―Ancient drinking toast[src]

Caladan is the third planet orbiting the star Delta Pavonis. It is a lush oceanic world, and the ancestral home of House Atreides.

16.content:
Chani Kynes, also known by her intimate name Sihaya (meaning Desert Spring), was the Fremen bound concubine of Emperor Paul Atreides. 

Physical appearance: Chani is skinny with an elfin face and has pure, dark blue eyes with no white in them. She has long tawny-red hair.

17.content:
Chapterhouse is the term used by the Bene Gesserit for the planet considered to be their home base. This planet has changed over the centuries of the existence of the Bene Gesserit. Speculation would put the original Bene Gesserit home base on the planet Rossak.

The planet used as the secret headquarters of the Bene Gesserit is seen as a temporary base, and because of this the planet is never quite 100% settled and if needed, the Bene Gesserit can completely abandon the planet in very short notice leaving very little trace of their time spent.

Chapterhouse has been the same planet for more than 1500 years, which means "temporary" headquarters is somewhat of a loose term.

18.content: Combine Honnete Ober Advancer Mercantiles (CHOAM) is one of the major galactic organisations in the Imperium, a gigantic monopoly encompassing all forms of commerce across the Imperium which essentially control all economic affairs across the cosmos, although it relies upon the Spacing Guild for transport across space due to the Guild's monopoly on faster-than-light travel. CHOAM touches almost all products the Guild will transport, from art forms to technology and of course melange. Many Houses depend on CHOAM profits, and an enormous proportion of those depend on melange. Most economic ventures are conducted through CHOAM, in which the Imperial House, the Landsraad, the Bene Gesserit and the Spacing Guild all have a stake.

19.content:
A crysknife is a knife whose blade is made from the tooth of a dead sandworm of Arrakis. It is the weapon of choice for the Fremen, the natives of Arrakis.  It is a curved and double-edged blade (double-edged like a kindjal), some 20 centimeters long, milky white in color and iridescent, and has a black handle with deep finger ridges separated from the blade by a slim round ring instead of a shearing-guard. The tip of a crysknife is also commonly poisoned, with an unnamed poison residing where the nerve of the tooth used to be. This poison is quick-acting and powerful.

Crysknives usually came in two forms:
    Unfixed: Knives where the blade will disintegrate unless they are kept close to a human body's electrical field,
    Fixed: Knives that have been treated so that they will not disintegrate, and can be put into storage.

2.content: The spice has narcotic properties, thus increasing demand and creating a large and hungry market for it. An individual's addiction to the spice will worsen the more they consume it. Once a person's eyes turn blue on blue, to stop taking the spice is to die an agonizing death.

20.content:
A Deathstill is a place where the water of a person's dead body can be reclaimed. On Arrakis, water is the most precious commodity. According to Fremen tradition, a man's water belongs to his tribe. As a result, the Fremen developed deathstills as a way of reclaiming the water of their dead, since it belongs to the tribe, and the dead have no further use of it.
The Fremen also put the deathstills to use for reclaiming the water of their enemies. It is usual practice for Fremen women and children to go through a battlefield when fighting is over, killing the wounded soldiers of the enemies with their crysknives, so that their water can be reclaimed in the deathstills.

21.content:
"We don’t have much time, as you well know. They’ll be here with Sardaukar disguised as Harkonnens at the first opportunity."
    ―Leto Atreides I regarding the approaching Siege of Arrakeen to Thufir Hawat

The Desert War, also known as the Harkonnen war or more formally as the Arrakis Affair, was a major conflict which took place primarly on the desert planet Arrakis, with foundations as early as the 10150s AG, but officially beginning in 10191 AG and ending in 10196 AG. It marked the fall of the Corrinos from power and the rise of a new empire.

22.content:
One of the titles given to the head of a Great House during the time of the Faufreluches. 

Duke is usually bestowed upon the head of a House that rules a Duchy as a siridar fief.

House Atreides was headed by a Duke.

Other titles for House leaders included Baron, Archduke, and Count. Senior women in Households were often given the title of Lady.

23.content:
Duncan Idaho was originally a Ginaz Swordmaster in the service of the honorable House Atreides during the last days of the Corrino Empire, and one of the Duke Leto's right-hand men, with Gurney Halleck and Mentat Thufir Hawat, and regarded as something of a ladies' man.
After falling in the Desert War on Arrakis, he grew in importance from this relatively obscure role through a Tleilaxu ghola incarnation, playing a key role as a Mentat in the final plot against Emperor Muad'Dib. 

    "Duncan Idaho. Killer extraordinary. Lover of many women. Swordsman soldier. Atreides field-hand on the field of battle."
    ―Bijaz describing the original Duncan to Hayt

Rebirth (10196-10219): The ghola Hayt.

Abilities and Skills
    Swordmaster. 
    Resistance to the Voice.

24.content:
"Our ancestor, Assur-nasir-apli, who was known as the cruellest of the cruel, seized the throne by slaying his own father and starting the reign of the sword. His conquests included the Uramia Lake region which led him for Commagene and Khabur. His son recieved tribute from the Shuites, from Tyre, Sidon, Gebel and even from Jehu, son of Omri, whose very name struck terror into thousands. The conquests which began with Assur-nasi-apli carried arms into Media and later into Israel, Damascus, Edom, Arpad, Babylon and Umlias. Does anyone remember these names and places now? I have given you enough clues: try to name the planet."
    ―The Stolen Journals

Earth, also called Old Earth, Terra, or Old Terra, was the third planet located in the Sol star system. The human race originated there. It was where the Commission of Ecumenical Translators converged to assemble the Orange Catholic Bible after the Butlerian Jihad.

25.content:
Edric is a Navigator in the Spacing Guild, and a conspirator in a secret plot to kill Paul Atreides and end the young Atreides Empire. 

Biography: Due to his relative power within the Guild, and his ability to elude Paul's prescience abilities, Edric is a principle conspirator. However, the group's plot is discovered and revealed to Paul by his Fremen friend and faithful follower Otheym.

26.content: The title given to Paul Atreides upon his ascension to the Golden Lion Throne in 10196 AG.

27.content:
A Face Dancer is a member of a race bred by the Bene Tleilax. The warrior and worker class, who were capable of adapting their physical appearance to a specific task at hand. Their doppelganger ability was also used to perform espionage against other groups. Their standing in Tleilaxu society falls below that of Tleilaxu Master, and their ability to mimic other individuals makes them popular for numerous roles, including spies and assassins. 

Physical Attributes: Tleilaxu Face Dancers have the ability to take on the physical appearance of other individuals. Their name comes from the fact that when they change shape their faces appear to 'dance' as the flesh moves.

Limitations: Pheromones can be detected by a Bene Gesserit adept. A Bene Gesserit Sister or Reverend Mother can detect them by a subtle but distinct odor emitted by their pheromones.The The Face Dancer can become delusional and start to believe that they are in fact the person they are mimicking. When this happens, they fall outside Bene Tleilax control and need to be killed, often exposing the Tleilaxu infiltration in the process.

28.content:
Farok is a Fremen from Sietch Tabr. He is one of the Fedaykin.

During Muad'dib's Jihad, Farok becomes Bashar of the Ninth Legion and fights on a number of worlds including Enfeil, where he leads his legion to victory, and Naraj, where his son is blinded by a stone burner.

Later, Farok is killed by Scytale shortly before he takes Lichna's identity.

29.content: Fedaykin was originally a word used to describe the Fremen's guerrilla fighters, and is now used in reference to Muad'Dib's personal guard—his death commandos. By the time Leto and Ghanima Atreides are born, the term Fedaykin had become synonymous with the elite of Muad'dib's Jihad army.

3.content:
"The Fremen see her as the Earth Figure, a demi-goddess whose special charge is to protect the tribes through her powers of violence. She is Reverend Mother to their Reverend Mothers. To pilgrims who seek her out with demands that she restore virility or make the barren fruitful, she is a form of anti-mentat. She feeds on that strong human desire for the mysterious. She is living proof that the 'analytic' has limits. She represents ultimate tension. She is the virgin-harlot - witty, vulgur, cruel, as destructive in her whims as a coriolis storm."
    ―St Alia-of-the-Knife as taken from The Irulan Report

Alia Atreides is the sister of Paul Atreides and the daughter of Lady Jessica, born on the planet Arrakis.

30.content: Bene Gesserit are able to control their own fertility. Exercising control over their own menstrual cycle and (at conception) their child's sex. They can choose when to get pregnant and the gender of their child in order to produce children when and where the order wishes, following the Bene Gesserit breeding program.

31.content:
This small barb-like needle delivers potent drugs or poisons, upon penetrating the skin of the intended victim. It is so named for the protective "flip-cover" used to conceal the needle, and to protect its user from inadvertent harm. Flip-darts can be concealed within ornamented finger rings, fighting girdles, wrist bracers, or weapon sheaths.

Length: 0.5 centimeters

Mass: negligible

32.content: The Fremen are a sub-culture of humans descended from the Zensunni Wanderers who consider the planet Arrakis their home. They form an integral part in the establishment of the Atreides Empire and Muad'Dib's Jihad launched by Paul Atreides, their adopted leader.

33.content: Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam is a Bene Gesserit Reverend Mother. Mohiam trained the Lady Jessica in the Bene Gesserit chapterhouse on Wallach IX. Two decades later, Mohiam had become the Truthsayer to Padishah Emperor Shaddam Corrino IV and tested the young Paul Atreides before his departure for Arrakis with the gom jabbar. The test was to discover whether Paul was "truly human" by trial of pain, using a small box that Paul placed his hand inside. The pain inflicted on Paul was caused by nerve induction and clearly drained an incredible amount of energy from the Reverend Mother, since no male or female child had ever withstood that much physical pain before.

34.content: Ghanima Atreides (b. 10210 AG) is the daughter of Paul Atreides and his Fremen concubine Chani Kynes. She iss born a little time before her twin brother Leto Atreides II.

35.content:
Swordmaster is a title awarded to warriors attaining a certain level of skill in the Ginaz School, during the time of the Faufreluches.
Many Great Houses maintain their own Swordmasters as commanders, teachers, and personal guards for their family members.
Swordmasters of Ginaz are regarded as superior warriors in every way, superior even to a Sardaukar.
Duncan Idaho was Swordmaster for House Atreides. It was partially through his instruction that the Atreides were able to train a small army that rivaled the Sardaukar in ability in 10,191 A.G.
The name 'Swordmaster' comes from the fact that adepts are highly skilled in bladed weapons (namely knives and swords) and hand-to-hand combat, which re-entered human warfare after shielding systems made the use of guns futile.

36.content:
A Glowglobe is a suspensor-buoyed illuminating device. They are self-powered (usually by organic batteries) and usually emit pale yellow light, but can be tuned to a low orange colour. Glowglobes are portable and can follow a person around, or be caged or anchored in a specific location.
The exact workings of glowglobes are not elaborated on, but they can be extinguished with a touch.

37.content:
The Golden Lion Throne is the name given to the seat of power for House Corrino, since the symbol of that great House was the golden lion.
During the days of the Imperium, the name is also synonymous with the Imperial throne, since House Corrino had been the rulers of the Old Imperium for thousands of years. Many Great Houses aspired to place one of their own on the Golden Lion Throne.
The Golden Lion Throne itself is said to have been carved out of a single piece of Hagal quartz.

38.content:
The Great Convention is a historic treaty brokered between the Great Houses, the Spacing Guild, and the Imperium shortly after the destruction of the thinking machines. It prohibits the use of atomics against human targets.

Volume 30, section 6.3
    By mutual agreement between the Federated Council of the Landsraad and House Corrino, the regulation was designed to prohibit Emperors from taking sides but act as a neutral arbiter; It concerns situations of House-to-House warfare, in which an appeal to the Emperor has been made by one side.
    The Emperor is required either to render immediate assistance, or convene an emergency Security Council meeting to deal with the matter. If he doesn't, an Ambassador is within his rights to convene the Council himself.

39.content:
A Guild Navigator is a senior rank of artificially super-evolved humans within the Spacing Guild and for many Guildsmen the pinnacle of their ambitions. Mutated through the consumption of and exposure to massive amounts of the spice Melange, Navigators are able to use a mentally conditioned and trained form of prescience to safely navigate interstellar and galactic space in long-range starships called Heighliners. 

Physical Description: To enable their prescience, Guild Navigators not only consume large quantities of the spice, but are also continuously immersed in highly-concentrated amounts of orange spice gas housed in large tanks. This level of extreme and extended exposure causes their bodies to atrophy and mutate over time, their heads and extremities elongating. The first external sign of melange-induced metabolic change is visible in the eyes, as the drug tints the sclera and iris to a dark shade of blue. The shade of blue is known to be called "blue-in-blue" or "the Eyes of Ibad," "a total blue so dark as to be almost black." This is a common side effect in all spice addicts.

4.content:
Arrakeen is one of the largest cities on the desert planet Arrakis, and its seat of power.

At the rise of Emperor Muad'Dib, Arrakeen became an Imperial capital of staggering proportions. The Bene Gesserit, the Bene Tleilax, and other groups maintain a presence there in various forms.

Description: It is located near the northern pole of the planet, and sits on a mass of bedrock. This, in conjunction with the protection afforded by the Shield Wall, prevented any incursions from sandworms.

40.content: Members of the Spacing Guild that are perform administrative and technical duties in support of Guild Navigators use of Guild Heighliners.

41.content:
Gurney Halleck [b. 10130s AG] was the Warmaster for House Atreides during the reign of Leto Atreides I, and then his son Paul. Recently, he is the Earl of Caladan and Siridar-Baron of Giedi Prime.

Physical Appearance: Gurney Halleck is an ugly lump of a man with brawny arms and long-fingered hands with large thumbs. He has wispy blond hair that trails over barren spots on his forehead, and a lumpy face with flat features, a too-round nose, a lumpy chin, and blue glass-splinter eyes.

42.content:
Duncan Idaho is returned to life as a ghola, a clone made by the Bene Tleilax and gifted to Paul Atreides, which is supposed to tempt the Kwisatz Haderach into becoming that which he despises. Known as 'Hayt' in his ghola incarnation, Idaho is trained as a Mentat and a Zensunni philosopher. He has no memory of his former life, but constantly feels vague hints and reminders of his previous incarnation that make him hope he can recover those memories (this has never previously been possible with gholas).

Abilities and Skills
    Swordfighting
    Mentat training
    Resistance to Voice

Idaho shed this name when his original memories were restored during a deadly encounter with Padishah Emperor Paul Atreides and the Tleilaxu face dancer Scytale, after the death of Paul's concubine Chani.

43.content: Taken regularly, melange can increase life expectancy and fortify overall health levels (in many cases life expectancy iss tripled).

44.content:
A Heighliner is a spacefolder starship used by the Spacing Guild to transport people and equipment across the known universe.
Guild Heighliners are usually immense in size, easily accommodating many thousands of passengers, whole fleets of smaller vessels, and the vast export of planetary goods.
Spacing Guild Heighliners can be used to fold space to travel vast distances across the universe in an instant. They are piloted by Guild Navigators and Steersmen.
A Spacefolder is a space craft capable of travelling at faster than light speeds, thanks to the Holtzman Effect. During the Corrino and Atreides Empires, spacefolder vessels are controlled exclusively by the Spacing Guild, and referred to as Guild Heighliners.

45.content:
The Holtzman Effect or Holtzmann Effect is a scientific theory relating to the repellant force of subatomic particles, and is part of a branch of scientific discoveries in the area of physics to bear the root name Holtzman.
The effects of this theory were felt on humanity for tens of thousands of years, and proved to be the catalyst for rapid technological developments in several areas. These include:

    Shields.
    Suspensors.
    Glowglobes.
    Space travel.

46.content:
House Atreides is one of the Houses Major within the infrastructure of the Imperium. They are ruled by the patriarch of the Atreides family, who takes the title of Duke. 

Arrakis is the current home of House Atreides.

47.content: The Imperial House Corrino was once the deadliest and grandest House Major found within the Known universe, and for many thousands of years the imperial family of the Imperium. The official residence of the Imperial House Corrino was the planet Kaitain while their personal fief is the ancestral planet Salusa Secundus.

48.content: House Harkonnen, also known as the Family Harkonnen, was a Great House of the Landsraad, with their capital on the heavily industrialised Giedi Prime. The Harkonnens were the historical enemies of House Atreides of Caladan, with whom they maintained an ancient feud since the Battle of Corrin. They also came to be recognized for their underhanded and sinister political tactics, fueled by ambition, malevolence, hatred and brutality. Typically ruled by a Siridar Baron, the Harkonnens were essentially annihilated after the Battle of Arrakeen, though the family line is continued on Giedi Prime.

49.content:
The hunter-seeker is a deadly tool used by assassins. The tiny floating tadpole-like machine is remotely controlled by an operator situated close by.

Stats
Velocity: up to 25 meters per second
Length: 1 centimeter
Mass: Negligible
Range: up to 50 meters
Ammunition: Single needle

Operation and Technology: The device floats through the air, using a tiny Holtzman Field Generator to maneuver. The tip holds a camera that transmits a video signal back to the operator. Vision is distorted by the compressed suspensor field. Once detected, the target is almost guaranteed to be killed.
The killing device itself is a tiny needle, tipped with a quick-acting, lethal poison. The needle is retracted until a target is acquired, at which point it appears, shortly before the device shoots into the victim.

Counteraction: Destroying a Hunter-seeker is rather simple. Like any machine, it can be destroyed by being smashed or submerged in water. Paul Atreides employed both means to destroy a Hunter-seeker that had been launched to kill him on Arrakis, shortly before the invasion of House Harkonnen.

5.content:
a harsh desert planet located on the far edge of the Imperium in the Canopus star system. It becames the Imperium's center under Muad'Dib's empire. It is the original and sole source of the Spice Melange, which is vital for space travel. 

The surface of Arrakis consists almost exclusively of dry dune deserts, hence the planet's alternative name, Dune. Various weathered mountain ranges stretch across the planet, breaking up the deserts and sheltering the limited native lifeforms. Rock outcroppings also litter the planet's surface.
Little native life survives on Arrakis, owing to its scorching heat and dry climate. The various lifeforms that do endure are eclipsed by the sandworms, which roam the deep deserts of the planet. The sandworms play an important role in the production of melange, and they aggressively protect their desert territory from humans and other sandworms alike.

50.content: Title assigned to young and training Bene Gesserit. On successful completion of their training, they are promoted to the rank of Sister in the Bene Gesserit order.

51.content: A Bene Gesserit is trained to develop complete control over the functions of their internal organs and body chemistry. The Bene Gesserit are therefore immune to poisons, as they can simply change the chemical makeup of any harmful substance in their body and render it harmless. This ability is used when potential Reverend Mothers take the Water of Life in order to survive the ordeal and gain Other Memory. Their control over their body chemistry is so refined that a Bene Gesserit can even control the ageing process and slow it dramatically. However, they would never attempt this, as it might call attention to the Sisterhood and reveal too much of their abilities.

52.content: Princess Irulan Corrino is the eldest daughter of the 81st Padishah Emperor Shaddam Corrino IV, and Anirul, a Bene Gesserit of Hidden Rank. She is also the wife, in title only, of Emperor Paul Atreides, and an important historian who chronicles the events of Paul's rise to the Imperial throne through a series of written works.

53.content:
Lady Jessica of the Atreides, born Jessica Nerus, was the official concubine of Duke Leto Atreides I, and the mother of Emperor Paul Atreides. She is also a Reverend Mother of the Bene Gesserit Sisterhood and the Fremen, and an integral figure in Paul's rise to emperor.  

Physical Appearance: Jessica is a tall, slim woman with bronze-colored hair that she often wears tied with black ribbon at the crown. She has an oval face with eyes as green as the morning skies of Caladan, a small, slightly upturned nose, and a wide, generous mouth. In her later years her hair becomes flecked with silver.

54.content:
Kanly is the enactment of a formal feud or vendetta in a manner that complies with the Great Convention. It often results in an official war of attrition between two opponents, usually Great Houses.

Examples of Kanly: Kanly has occurred most famously between House Atreides and House Harkonnen, and between House Moritani and House Ecaz, the Atreides/Harkonnen feud having gone on for millennia, since the end of the Butlerian Jihad. In both situations, Kanly resulted in the dramatic success of the former party over the latter.
Kanly requires that certain forms of conflict are permitted, while others are not. The use of nuclear weapons is forbidden, for example. Usage of nuclear weapons usually means a sentence of exile.

55.content:
A Kindjal is a slightly curved double-edged long knife or short sword, with a blade approximately 20 cm long. Many family members of Great Houses are taught how to wield this weapon.
Duke Leto Atreides carried such a weapon on his person.

Stats

Blade length: @ 20 cm

Mass: 0.25 - 0.3 kilograms

56.content:
Kwisatz Haderach is a term used primarily by the Bene Gesserit. It is an old Chakobsa term that translates literally as "Shortening of the Way". 

Powers and Abilities:
    Prescience
    Genetic Memory

57.content: The Kwisatz mother is the Bene Gesserit that possesses the strongest tie to Other Memory and the voices of the past. She is in charge of and directs the breeding program to create the Kwisatz Haderach.

58.content:
Lady is a title bestowed upon women who are in the upper eschelons of nobility during the time of the Faufreluches.
While the title is used for noble-born women, women of the Bene Gesserit Sisterhood will take the title of Lady when they are bequeathed to Great Houses, either as concubines or as wives.

59.content: The Landsraad is a council that includes all of the Great Houses. The Landsraad council meets regularly and provides a forum within which Great Houses can relate to one another for negotiating trade agreements, creating alliances, conducting kanly, banishment of Houses in cases of breaches to the Great Convention, and protecting the Great Houses from being singled-out by the Imperial House.

6.content: The Arrakis Revolt is the term historically used to describe the uprising of the Fremen of Arrakis under the leadership of Paul Atreides, in the latter events of the Desert War, which eventually led to the fall of House Corrino from power.

60.content:
A lasgun is a continuous-wave laser projector weapon. It commonly takes the form of a pistol or rifle. Its firing pattern is typically a constant, narrow beam, but the nozzle can sometimes be adjusted to alter the width and spread of the beam. Its power source is a cell cartridge that can be replaced when depleted.

Size and form can vary from small, handheld lasguns to long field-models and large and armored heavy duty models. The Cutteray is essentially a Short-range version of a lasgun used mostly as a cutting tool and surgeon's scalpel.

During the time of the Faufreluches, many soldiers and assassins prefer knives and swords in combat, both because they safely penetrate personal shields, and because of newfound appreciation for the art of swordsmanship. 

Stats

Length: 45 - 90 centimeters (stock)
Mass: 2 - 5 kilograms
Settings: 3 (Pulse-fire, Arc-fire, Full burn)
Range: 5 - 225 meters
Ammunition: 100 charges in power cell (good for 100 pulses or 20 arcs per cell)

61.content: Leto was born on Arrakis to then-Padishah Emperor Paul Atreides and his Fremen concubine Chani Kynes, the daughter of the great Liet Kynes, just after his twin sister Ghanima Atreides. He and his sister were preborn due to Chani's consumption of the spice melange in large amounts before her death. He was named after the Duke Leto Atreides I, his paternal grandfather, and Leto Atreides II the Elder, his older brother, who was murdered in infancy.

62.content:
Lichna is the daughter of Otheym.
Lichna is a known semuta addict, and betrothed to the blind son of Farok. She iss later killed and impersonated by Scytale as part of the plot to kill Muad'Dib.

63.content:
A Maula pistol is a hand-held weapon, used to fire poison darts. It has a range of approximately 40 metres. Maula pistols usually maintain a spring-loaded mechanism. They are popular weapons during the Wars of Assassins in the days of the Faufreluches.
These weapons are especially effective on Arrakis (where shields were rarely in use), and are often used by the Fremen. 

Stats

    Length: 15 - 20 centimeters (barrel)
    Mass: 0.5 - 1 kilogram
    Range: 5 - 40 meters
    Ammunition: 10 rounds per clip

64.content:
"He who controls the spice, controls the universe!" 
    -Baron Vladimir Harkonnen

    "melange (me-lange also ma,lanj) n-s, original uncertain (thought to derive from ancient Terran Franzh): a. mixture of spices; b. spice of Arrakis (Dune) with geriatric properties first noted by Yanshuph Ashkoko, royal chemist in reign of Shakkad the Wise; Arrakeen melange, found only in deepest desert sands of Arrakis, linked to prophetic visions of Paul Muad'Dib (Atreides), first Fremen Mahdi; also employed by Spacing Guild Navigators and the Bene Gesserit."
    ―Dictionary Royal, fifth edition

 The Spice Melange, referred to simply as 'the spice', is a naturally produced awareness spectrum narcotic that forms a fundamental block of commerce and technological development in the known universe. It plays an important role in travel and cultural development, vital for space travel by enabling Navigators to safely guide space ships through fold space.
It is produced exclusively on the planet Arrakis.

Effects on those who consume melange are:
    Mind alteration
    Health benefits
    Addictiveness
    Physical effects

Groups critically dependent on the Spice:
    Bene Gesserit
    Spacing Guild
    Fremen

65.content:
A Mentat is a profession or discipline that was developed as a replacement to the computers and thinking machines following the Butlerian Jihad that banned the creation of machines in the human mind's image, just as the Spacing Guild and the Bene Gesserit took up similar functions. 

Abilities:
    Human Calculator
    Exceptional cognitive memory and perception
    Supralogical hypothesizing
    Strategy and Tactics

A Mentat's capabilities can be greatly increased by taking sapho juice, but using it leads to addiction. Sapho is extracted from the root of the Ecaz tree and its use doubles or even triples the Mentat's immense processing power. Repeated use turns the user's lips a shade of red.
    The Tleilaxu have found a way to create Twisted Mentats, that bypass the ethical framework instilled in all traditionally trained Mentats.

The Mentat Mantra:
"It is by will alone I set my mind in motion. It is by the juice of Sapho that thoughts acquire speed, the lips acquire stains, the stains become a warning. It is by will alone I set my mind in motion."

66.content: Melange can awaken dormant parts of the human mind and encourage expanded sensory perceptions. In some humans (notably the Bene Gesserit, Guild Navigators, and some members of the Atreides bloodline), heavy doses lead to powerful abilities that include prescience.

67.content:
Muad'Dib's Jihad, also known as Paul's Jihad, is an event that occurrs throughout the Known Universe after the rise of Paul-Muad'Dib and his rise to Emperor of the Imperium.
This Jihad spreads throughout the entire universe, pillaging millions of planets. 
The only planet that is spared the raging fire of Muad'Dib's Jihad is the home world of House Atreides, Caladan. Lady Jessica, mother of Paul Muad'Dib, refuses the Fremen any access to the planet, including religious pilgrimage.

68.content: Naib (نائب) is a Zensunni and Fremen term used to denote the leader of a Sietch. A Naib is typically male. In the language of the Fremen, Naib means, "one who has sworn never to be taken alive by the enemy". To become a Naib, one has to fight and kill the previous Naib.

69.content:
This small projectile weapon resembles a wristwatch in size and form. Too small to contain more than a single envenomed dart, needle guns are easy to conceal and light to wear...and typically hidden beneath long baggy sleeves. To discharge the weapon, its user needs only point his arm toward the target and lift his hand from the missile trajectory; this triggers the reflexive firing mechanism. Needle guns are often worn in pairs.

Length: 3 - 5 centimeters (barrel)

Mass: negligible

Range: 1 - 10 meters

7.content:
The Atreides Empire, also known as the Atreides Imperium, Muad'Dib's Empire, the Second Empire, the Holy Imperium, is a colossal theocratic, multi-galactic empire established following Paul Atreides' Fremen uprising on Arrakis against the Corrino Empire, which currently oversees Muad'Dib's Jihad to pacify the Imperium.
The commencement of the Atreides Empire is marked by the moving of the Imperial seat from Kaitain to Arrakeen on Arrakis. Paul, as Emperor Muad'Dib, rules the empire.

70.content: Upon tasting an item, a Bene Gesserit can break down the food into its ingredients, right down to its chemical composition and determine what is in it.

71.content:
The Orange Catholic Bible is one of the most important religious texts in the known universe.
It is a fusion of all significant religious thought in human history, with a strong emphasis on religious beliefs originating on Earth. It was produced by the Commission of Ecumenical Translators in the wake of the Butlerian Jihad. Its supreme commandment is:

"Thou shalt not disfigure the soul." 

Selected Quotes from the Commission's Orange Catholic Bible Commentaries

    The meek shall inherit the universe.

    When law and religious duty are one, your selfdom encloses the universe.

    Thou shalt not make a machine in the likeness of a human mind.

    The Universe is God's. It is one thing, a wholeness against which all separations may be identified. Transient life, even that self-aware and reasoning life which we call sentient, holds only fragile trusteeship on any portion of the wholeness.

    Paradise on my right, Hell on my left and the Angel of Death behind.

    Some Lies are easier to believe than the truth.

    Knowledge is pitiless.

    Fate and Hope only rarely speak the same language.

    Beware the seeds you sow and the crops you reap. Do not curse God for the punishment you inflict upon yourself.

72.content:
Other Memory is the term used by the Bene Gesserit Sisterhood to describe the well of genetic memory their Reverend Mothers possess. 
Non-Bene-Gesserit users of Other Memory include Paul Atreides, Alia Atreides, Ghanima Atreides, and Leto Atreides II.
Other Memory is used mainly as a source of knowledge, especially when much written history has been lost to time. It is only made available to an individual after they successfully convert an Awareness spectrum narcotic like the Water of Life. If they fail, they die.

73.content:
Otheym is a renowned Fremen fighter and devoted follower of Paul Atreides. He was a key figure in the training of Fremen fighters in the Weirding Way, and in the liberation of Arrakis from House Harkonnen.
Originally from Sietch Gara Kulon, Otheym came to Sietch Tabr to join Muad'dib's crusade and was one of the first Fedaykin. Otheym was also the one tasked with taking the Waters of Life to a very large pre-spice mass, which if intiated, would have created a deadly chain reaction ultimately destroying all vectors of the sandworm.
Otheym serves as a senior commander in the spread of Muad'dib's Jihad across the Known Universe. He returns to Dune after contracting the spitting disease on Tarahell. A true Fremen and friend to Muad'dib until the end, Otheym provided details on those plotting against the Atreides Emperor. He had one daughter named Lichna with his wife Dhuri.

74.content:
"He was warrior and mystic, ogre and saint, the fox and the innocent, chivalrous, truthless, less than a god, more than a man. There is no measuring Muad'Dib's motives by ordinary standards. In the moment of his triumph, he saw the death prepared for him, yet he accepted the treachery. Can you say he did this out of a sense of justice? Whose justice, then? Remember, we speak now of the Muad'Dib who ordered battle drums made from his enemies' skins, the Muad'Dib who denied the conventions of his ducal past with a wave of the hand, saying merely: "I am the Kwisatz Haderach. That is reason enough.""
    ―from "Arrakis Awakening" by the Princess Irulan

Abilities
    Prescience
    Weirding Way
    Voice
    Prana-bindu control
    Swordfighting
    Mentat training
    Endurance: Paul's unusual endurance, especially for a male, was noted by Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam when she tested him with a gom jabbar, a test which he passed through this skill. She noted that he surmounted more agony in the test than any other human of record.

75.content: The Bene Gesserit ability to monitor minutiae in others to detect concealed emotions, motivations, agendas, or even physical things such as concealed weapons, a false accent, surgery, or deception in general. This particular skill was useful in detecting face dancers.

76.content: Sustained use of the spice leads to human eyes being discolored so that the entire eye will be stained blue - so called Eyes of Ibad. Extensive exposure to the spice creates a huge physical dependency that can radically alter the entire body (see Guild Navigators).

77.content:
Prana-bindu training denotes supreme control of nerve and muscles.
Prana-bindu training is a cornerstone of the Bene Gesserit, and all members are trained in this way.
Paul Atreides was also trained in this manner, and it is likely that prana-bindu training is the basis of the Weirding Way.

This Bene Gesserit ability is used in the alteration of blood flow, body temperature, heart rate, and level of consciousness, for the purposes of survival in harsh environments, or escaping from bonds. A Bene Gesserit can completely control their breathing and heart rate to the degree that they can appear dead to most tests even after intense physical exertion. They can control their need for food and water to the extremes of hunger and thirst, and even commit suicide at will by simply stopping their hearts or shutting down their brains.

78.content:
"Muad'Dib gave us a particular kind of knowledge about prophetic insight, about the behaviour which surrounds such insight and its influence upon events which are seen to be on line.' (That is, events which are set to occur in a related system which the prophet reveals and interprets.) As has been noted elsewhere, such insight operates as a peculiar trap for the prophet himself. He can become the victim of what he knows - which is a relatively common human failing. The danger is that those who predict real events may overlook the polarizing effect brought about by overindulgence in their own truth. They tend to forget that nothing in a polarized universe can exist without its opposite being present."
    ―The Prescient Vision by Harq al-Ada


Prescience was the term commonly used to describe the ability to see into both the past, present and future. Some awareness spectrum narcotics allowed their users to become prescient. The spice melange was one example among many in the Imperium.

79.content: A Bene Gesserit Reverend Mother In charge of a chapter house, each chapter house has a Proctor Superior.

8.content:
The females of the Tleilaxu are converted into Axlotl Tanks. Little more than incubation vessels, this class breeds all Tleilaxu, as well as other beings (such as gholas). 
An Axlotl tank or Axolotl tank is the means by which the Bene Tleilax reproduce a living human being from the cells of a cadaver, producing a type of clone called a ghola. These tanks are also used in the creation of genetically engineered assassins known as Face Dancers.

80.content: Members of the Bene Gesserit who have undergone the Spice Agony and survived. They fill the role of advisors, faculty, historians, geneticists. General authority of the Order for most members and the outside populace.

81.content: The head of the Bene Gesserit. The Reverend Mother Superior maintains ultimate control of the entire order, and invokes nearly unquestioned loyalty among the subordinate Reverend Mothers. A Reverend Mother chooses her successor prior to her death, and imparts her memories and personality to her. The inheritance of the Reverend Mother Superiors, at times, diverged among multiple Reverend Mothers, usually for strategic reasons.

82.content:
Salusa Secundus is the third planet in the Gamma Waiping star system, and the designated homeworld of House Corrino during its early history, though it later became a prison planet after the migration of the Royal court to the paradise planet Kaitain.

Environment: A harsh place, with many wild beasts, extreme temperatures, and difficult terrain. It is noted for being one of the only two planets in the Universe where shigawire can grow.

Under Shaddam IV: In 10193 AG, Paul Atreides wrested the Imperial Throne from House Corrino. Before taking the throne, Paul promised Shaddam IV that he would keep a throne on Salusa Secundus, and that the planet would be transformed into a pleasant and beautiful world. This move was outwardly to show that he maintained respect for Shaddam, but in truth the move was to rob the deposed Emperor of the training grounds for his Sardaukar.

83.content:
Sandrider is the Fremen term for one who is capable of capturing and riding one of the great sandworms of Arrakis.
A Sandrider ready to catch a sandworm was called a Hookman, and a Sandrider riding a worm was called a Worm-Steersman.
In order to lead the Fremen, Paul Atreides had to become a sandrider. Normally, Fremen become sandriders by the age of twelve.

Sandrider Terms:

    Ach: left turn.
    Derch: right turn.
    Geyrat: straight ahead.
    Haiiiii-yoh!: command to action.

84.content:
The sandworm is an autotrophic animal that inhabits the planet Arrakis. Sandworms live in the vast deserts and sand dunes that stretch across the surface of the planet. Sandworms are an essential factor in the creation of the Spice Melange. Attracted to rhythmic vibrations on the surface, they will breach in pursuit of the origin of such vibrations.   The sandworms are extremely territorial; as soon as two worms sense each other's presence, they let out chuffing roars of challenge, bellowing melange-smelling exhaust from their cavernous throats.
Sandworms can grow to an enormous,up to 1000 meters long in the southern pole regions.
Sandworms look like giant earthworms with armored rings instead of soft bodies. They have a large maw filled with crystalline teeth used in processing the sands. They smell of cinnamon. The friction of their movement can create static electric lightning bolts. Water kills sandworms if they are immersed in it. The Fremen see the sandworm as the physical embodiment of their One God.

85.content:
The Sardaukar are the elite military force of the Padishah Emperor who served prominently during the Corrino Empire. They are renowned and feared throughout the Known Universe for their fanatic zeal, superior fighting abilities, and sheer ruthlessness. 

Personal Armament, Melee (short range):
    Flip-dart
    Kindjal
    Sardaukar knife
    Sardaukar sword
    Shigawire garrote
    Slip-tip

Personal Armament, Ranged:
    Hunter-seeker (mid-to-long range)
    Lasgun (long range)
    Maula pistol (long range)
    Needle gun (mid-range; see below)
    Stunner (mid-to-long range)
    Sardaukar throwing knife (long range)

Appearance and Fighting Style: Sardaukar troops typically wear uniforms and helmets of grey and black with gold trimming. Some of their members wear their hair long, which is taken as a sign of arrogance by those who behold them. They have a distinct combat style, which allowes them to be recognised easily.

86.content:
The term Sayyadina (meaning "friend of God" in Chakobsa) is used by the Fremen to describe their lower-ranking priestesses who have not yet changed the Water of Life and become Reverend Mothers.

Often, a woman will be consecrated as Sayyadina at the same time that the previous Sayyadina attempts the spice agony, so that all will not be lost if the potential Reverend Mother fails and dies. This occurred when Ramallo, at the end of her life, supervised Lady Jessica's spice agony; since Ramallo was moments from death, Chani, daughter of Liet, was consecrated as Sayyadina in the event that Jessica did not survive.

87.content:
Scytale is a Face Dancer of the Bene Tleilax. He is involved in a secret plot to destroy Emperor Muad'Dib and the royal family. 
Scytale was first sent to Wallach IX as the Tleilaxu representative in the conspiracy, and then to the Imperial capital of Arrakis, where he killed Farok, his blind son and their neighbor's daughter Lichna, who he impersonated, coming to the Emperor Muad’Dib as her to arrange his own collection of the secret Tleilaxu Master Bijaz, who was instrumental in reawakening Hayt’s memories as Duncan by getting him to attempt and fail to kill Paul. Disguised as Lichna, Scytale gifts Emperor Muad'Dib Hayt, the ghola of Duncan Idaho.

88.content: Truthsayers are trained to sense if someone is telling the truth or not, but  other Bene Gesserit can also spot if someone is holding something back.

89.content: Shaddam Corrino IV is the eighty-first and final Padishah Emperor of the Corrino Empire, and thus the Known Universe. Utilizing his Sardaukar and the forces of House Harkonnen, he orchestrated the death of Duke Leto Atreides of House Atreides on Arrakis out of fear of his popularity. This led to Leto's son, Paul Atreides, beginning the Desert War with Arrakis' natives, the Fremen, and eventually overthrowing Shaddam and exiling him to Salusa Secundus.

9.content: The pivotal event in the Arrakis Revolt of the Desert War, the Battle of Arrakeen was fought between Muad'Dib Paul Atreides's Fremen and the Padishah Emperor Shaddam Corrino IV's Imperial forces of Sardaukar. Muad'Dib's forces ultimately routed the Saudakar and the Emperor negotiated with Paul Atreides. During the negotiations, Feyd-Rautha Harkonnen, now the new Baron of House Harkonnen, challenged Muad'Dib to a kanly duel. Muad'Dib killed him and after his death, sealed an agreement that gave him control of the known universe.

90.content:
"Over here sand blows, over there sand blows. Over there a rich man waits, over here I wait."
    ―The Voice of Shai-Hulud, from the Oral History

Shai-Hulud is the Fremen term for the sandworm of Arrakis.

As with many Fremen terms and words, Shai-Hulud is more than a descriptive term for a physical entity. Specifically, it often alludes to the Fremen belief that the sandworm is a physical embodiment of the One God that created and governs the universe. Thus to the Fremen Shai-Hulud is a sacred term that is usually spoken with a tone of awe, fear, or respect.

Shai-Hulud is not to be mistaken with Shaitan, a similar-sounding Fremen term that carries a very different meaning.

Shai Hulud plays a massive role in Fremen culture. The Fremen are known to ride sandworms and even capture them, their teeth being made into Crysknifes, the Fremen weapon of choice.

91.content:
The Effect that allowed the creation of a shielding that repelled most methods of fast moving projectiles, but allowed slower moving objects, such as hand-held knives, to pass through. This changed the nature of warfare - conventional projectile weapons became mostly useless and laser weapons became incredibly dangerous, forcing humanity to return to the use of hand-weapons.

A defensive shield, commonly referred to as simply a shield and sometimes as a Holtzman shield, is a protective energy field that can surround the person who wears it. 

Shields used to protect installations can, and usually do, have far lower penetration velocities, as life support technologies can be used to recycle atmosphere while the shield is active.
However, if a lasgun beam hits a Holtzman field, it will result in sub-atomic fusion and a nuclear explosion. The center of this blast is determined by random chance; sometimes it will originate within the shield, sometimes within the laser weapon, sometimes both.

92.content:
Shigawire is a metallic extrusion of a ground vine (Narvi narviium) that is made into reels to transmit messages. Shigawire, due to its strength, can also be used as a garrote, as in the case of the Sardaukar.
Shigawire is only grown on Salusa Secundus and III Delta Kaising. It is noted for its extreme tensile strength.
Mimic film is another form of shigawire.

Garrote stats

Length: 6 centimeters (handles); 15 - 20 centimeters (wire)

Mass: Negligible

93.content:
"O Seas of Caladan, O people of Duke Leto - Citadel of Leto fallen, Fallen forever..."
    ―from "Songs of Muad'Dib" by the Princess Irulan


The Siege of Arrakeen, also known as the Battle of Arrakeen as well as the battle of two years later, was an event which took place in Arrakeen on the planet Arrakis in March 10191 AG.

94.content:
"The sietch at the desert rim was Liet's, was Kynes's, was Stilgar's, was Muad'Dib's, and, once more, was Stilgar's. The Naibs one by one sleep in the sand, but the sietch endures."
    ―from a Fremen song

Sietch is the Fremen term for a community or village. 

A sietch is typically located within the mountains or rock outcrops that are scattered throughout the deserts of Arrakis, hidden from the harsh sun Canopus. It is located within either a man-made or a naturally carved cave system, or occasionally a combination of both.
The actual size of the mountains and rock outcrops has to be quite large as was the network of tunnels and caves. It has to be capable of not only housing the hundreds or even thousands of Fremen families, but also large enough to house all the internal economies and industries, basically a small city and all the civic necessities that are needed even for a minimalist society like the Fremen community. Stillsuit manufacturing, processing spice and converting it into fibrous form, small scale farming, food processing, as well as the tribe's water storage, water reclamation facilities and power supply, seem to be common to most if not all sietch communities.

95.content:
Sietch Tabr is a major Fremen Sietch on Arrakis. Its most famous native-Fremen leader is Naib Stilgar.
Sietch Tabr was the Fremen community first encountered by Paul and Jessica Atreides after their escape from Harkonnen assassination attempts following the fall of House Atreides on Arrakis. As a result, it became their adopted home, and the foundation of the Arrakis Revolt; the resistance movement that eventually took control of Arrakis, and launched Paul's Jihad.
Although Sietch Tabr lost some of its new-found authority after Paul became Emperor and moved his base of operations to Arrakeen, it remains a powerful locale in Fremen culture and politics.

Places of Note:
    Briefing room
    Chani's lab
    Deathstill
    Hall of rites
    Rock ledge
    Sietch School
    Stilgar's quarters
    Water basin
    Windtrap
    Yali of Paul Muad'dib

96.content: The Sisters of the Bene Gesserit serve as agents, concubines, and potential wives.

97.content:
A Slip-Tip is any thin, short blade that is designed for left-hand use in shield fighting. A slip-tip will often be poison-tipped.
Feyd-Rautha Harkonnen used slip-tips when he would fight slave gladiators.

Stats

Blade length: 15 - 25 centimeters

Mass: 0.3 - 0.5 kilograms

98.content: The Spacing Guild, also called the Guild of Navigators on rare occasions, is an interstellar shipping and trade conglomerate during the years of the Corrino Empire and the Atreides Empire, and one leg of the political tripod maintaining the Great Convention. The Guild is the second mental-physical training school established after the Butlerian Jihad, the first being the Bene Gesserit Sisterhood, and the Guild monopoly on space travel and upon international banking was taken as the beginning point of the Imperial Calendar.

99.content:
A Spice orgy is the culmination of the Fremen Water of Life ritual. Once a Reverend Mother has converted the water from its poisonous state, the Fremen then drink of the changed water, which has narcotic properties.
Their inhibitions are lowered, some of their latent prescient and telepathic abilities come to the forefront, and the Fremen receive release from some of their pent-up emotions. Often wild dancing occurs, as well as sexual activity.
One of these occurred involving the Lady Jessica when she became the new Reverend Mother for the Fremen after she and Paul-Muad'Dib joined the group. Mother Ramallo who had served before Lady Jessica was too old in physical form to journey with the Fremen as they retreated to a new sietch and so passed on the water of life, Kan, on to Jessica who was with child at the time. Jessica then passes the converted drug on to Paul and the rest of the tribe which prompts a much heightened prescience in Paul.
